medications.name: Acetaminophen
medications.orientation: Acetaminophen is a pain reliever and a fever reducer.

medications.name: Ciprofloxacin
medications.orientation: Ciprofloxacin can cause serious side effects, including tendon problems, nerve damage, serious mood or behavior changes, or low blood sugar.

medications.name: Xanax
medications.orientation: Xanax (alprazolam) is a benzodiazepine (ben-zoe-dye-AZE-eh-peen). Alprazolam affects chemicals in the brain that may be unbalanced in people with anxiety.

medications.name: Hydrochlorothiazide
medications.orientation: Hydrochlorothiazide is a thiazide diuretic (water pill) that helps prevent your body from absorbing too much salt, which can cause fluid retention.

medications.name: Doxycycline
medications.orientation: Doxycycline is a tetracycline antibiotic that fights bacteria in the body.

medications.name: Prednisone
medications.orientation: Prednisone is a corticosteroid. It prevents the release of substances in the body that cause inflammation. It also suppresses the immune system.

medications.name: Gabapentin
medications.orientation: Zoloft (sertraline) is an antidepressant belonging to a group of drugs called selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs). Sertraline affects chemicals in the brain that may be unbalanced in people with depression, panic, anxiety, or obsessive-compulsive symptoms.

medications.name: Lyrica
medications.orientation: Lyrica (pregabalin) was originally FDA approved as an anti-epileptic drug, also called an anticonvulsant. It works by slowing down impulses in the brain that cause seizures. Pregabalin also affects chemicals in the brain that send pain signals across the nervous system.
